intro: Sida rhombifolia f. sampaioi, commonly known as the Brazilian ironweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its rhombic-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in coastal areas and can tolerate salt spray, making it suitable for coastal landscaping. Its fibrous stems and leaves have been used traditionally in some regions for their medicinal properties.
